concept_specific_keywords: in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed
concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.general_basket] Never called 'general basket' in agreement text (0/9 verbatim). Only 2/9 (LendingTree, Viavi) define it as 'General Debt Basket'. Others use 'other Indebtedness of the Borrower or any Restricted Subsidiary in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed...' — 'in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed' is the most universal anchor. Removed 'not otherwise permitted hereunder' (1/9, near-dead).
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'shall not incur' or 'Permitted Indebtedness' or 'incurrence of Indebtedness'. If none found, search for 'other Indebtedness' or 'aggregate principal amount' near negative covenant headings.
xref_follow: Section 1.01 for Indebtedness/Debt definition
Cross-references to ratio test / Leverage Ratio definition
Cross-references to Permitted Acquisition / Limited Condition Acquisition
Section 2.14/2.20 for Incremental Facility mechanics (incremental_facility basket lives there, not in neg cov section)

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.incremental_equiv_debt_cov] Incremental Equivalent Debt (5/9, 103 hits). Boyd calls its equivalent 'Ratio Debt' instead. Removed 'substantially equivalent' (0/9 in debt sections — only appears in definitions). Not present in Arch, Sleep Number, National Vision, Caesars (these deals lack IED mechanics entirely).
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'shall not incur' or 'Permitted Indebtedness' or 'incurrence of Indebtedness'. If none found, search for 'other Indebtedness' or 'aggregate principal amount' near negative covenant headings.

'assumed in connection with' and 'existed/existing at the time' are high-precision anchors for this basket within the section.

concept_specific_keywords: Loan Party to another Loan Party
concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.intercompany] Universal basket (9/9). Fixed: replaced 'owing to'/'owing by' (3-4% precision) with 'payable to any other' which catches Arch's 'Loan Party payable to any other Loan Party' pattern. Added 'Non-Guarantor Subsidiary' for sub-basket limitations. Sleep Number uses 'Company from a Company' and 'Foreign Subsidiary by a Credit Party' — unique phrasing, covered by section-level matching.
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'shall not incur' or 'Permitted Indebtedness' or 'incurrence of Indebtedness'. If none found, search for 'other Indebtedness' or 'aggregate principal amount' near negative covenant headings.

Cross-references to ratio test / Leverage Ratio definition
Cross-references to Permitted Acquisition / Limited Condition Acquisition
Section 2.14/2.20 for Incremental Facility mechanics (incremental_facility basket lives there, not in neg cov section)

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.purchase_money] Purchase Money (9/9) and Capital Lease (9/9) are universal. Finance Lease (3/9 — Boyd, Viavi, Red Rock) is newer GAAP terminology replacing Capital Lease. Capitalized Lease (6/9) is a common variant spelling.

Qualified/Permitted Receivables (5/9, 80 hits) is the defined term variant. Removed 'Qualified Securitization' (0/9 — completely dead) and 'factoring' (1/9, near-dead).

Removed 'Credit Agreement Refinancing' (0/9 in debt sections — only in definitions) and 'extend' (0.6% precision — extremely noisy, hits maturity extensions, time periods, etc.).

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.hedging_swap] Universal basket (9/9). Every deal permits hedging/swap obligations as a separate basket within the Indebtedness section. Typically short — 'Indebtedness in respect of Hedge Agreements' or 'Swap Obligations'. The defined terms 'Hedge Agreement' and 'Swap Agreement' are in Section 1.01.

National Vision uses 'Disqualified Stock or preferred stock' formulation. Removed 'Disqualified Capital Stock' (0/9 in debt sections — only in definitions). Absent in Arch, Sleep Number, Red Rock.

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.incremental_facility] Incremental facility mechanics (7/9, absent in Sleep Number and Arch). IMPORTANT: The substantive incremental provisions live in Article II (loan mechanics), NOT in the Indebtedness covenant section. The neg cov section typically just has a cross-reference basket (e.g., 'Indebtedness under Section 2.14'). Search must follow the xref to Article II to find the actual terms. Added 'Maximum Incremental Facilities Amount' and 'Incremental Cap' for National Vision's variant phrasing.
[neg_cov_debt.incremental_facility] xref_scope: Section 2.14 or 2.20 (not in the Indebtedness section itself)
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'shall not incur' or 'Permitted Indebtedness' or 'incurrence of Indebtedness'. If none found, search for 'other Indebtedness' or 'aggregate principal amount' near negative covenant headings.

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.cash_management] Present in 6/9 deals. Permits indebtedness under cash management/treasury services agreements. Defined term 'Cash Management Agreement' is in Section 1.01. Absent in simpler IG-style deals.

concept_specific_notes: [neg_cov_debt.guarantee] Universal basket (9/9). Added 'guaranties' (plural) — Sleep Number uses this exclusively. Contingent Obligation (7/9, 58 hits) is a defined term capturing guarantees and other contingent liabilities.

[neg_cov_debt.existing_indebtedness] Universal basket (9/9). Grandfather clause for debt existing at closing. Two patterns: (1) 'Indebtedness existing on the Closing Date and listed on Schedule X' (most deals), (2) Named defined term 'Existing Indebtedness' (some deals). Schedule reference is often the best anchor.

[neg_cov_debt.insurance_bonds] Insurance premium financing (8/9) and performance/surety bonds (8/9) are near-universal baskets. Often combined in a single basket clause. 'workers' compensation' and 'appeal bond' catch additional obligations that some deals include in the same basket.

[neg_cov_debt.subordinated] Two patterns: (1) Named basket with 'Subordinated Indebtedness'/'Subordinated Debt' as a defined term (4/9), (2) Subordination as a condition/requirement — 'subordinated to the Obligations' or 'subordinated in right of payment' (5/9 — Caesars, National Vision, Quidel use this). Removed 'Subordination Agreement' (0/9 in debt sections). Absent in Sleep Number (IG-style).
search_strategy.fallback_escalation: Search for 'shall not incur' or 'Permitted Indebtedness' or 'incurrence of Indebtedness'. If none found, search for 'other Indebtedness' or 'aggregate principal amount' near negative covenant headings.
